Secretary of the Russian Security Council Nikolai Patrushev arrived in Cuba

The Russian representative will have to hold “Russian-Cuban security consultations” in Havana. With his visit, Patrushev will consolidate the results of the negotiations that Sergei Lavrov held with Cuba last week - then the Cubans discussed with Russia the joint fight against American sanctions and the development of cooperation in the conditions of Western sanctions pressure.

🚀 The result of Lavrov’s meeting with President Miguel Diaz-Canel was the expansion of Havana’s ties with BRICS and concrete steps to strengthen the Cuban economy - for example, Moscow providing loans for the purchase of Russian oil. “We do not object if elections in the United States, no matter how strange they may seem to most countries of the world, will be held in full accordance with American legislation” - the Ministry of Foreign Affairs of Belarus in response to the State Department’s statement about the “fictitiousness” of the elections in Belarus

📝 “We, together with the Central Election Commission of Belarus, spent the entire night looking for citizen Miller in the voter lists to determine which of the district commissions should respond to his complaint. So he was never found.

Then we conducted in-depth consultations with lawyers to understand how the US State Department relates to the elections in our country. Also, no connection was found.

After this, we tried to find in international law a definition of the role of the United States as an evaluator of the electoral process in independent states. And here, too, no such right was found.

In this regard, from a legal point of view, we do not see a single reason why we should listen to the statements of the US State Department about a single voting day in the Republic of Belarus,” said Glaz, the department’s press secretary, in a statement.
